snippet: Paul Ryan of Wisconsin recycled an argument for lower taxes that surfaced in the ’80s and ’90s, but recent history suggests that higher taxes might help the economy.
abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column scrutinizes proposition that low tax rates produce higher economic growth, which has been central plank of Republican platform for as long as can be remembered; asserts that recent history suggests higher taxes might in fact be more helpful for economy.
lead_paragraph: Paul Ryan of Wisconsin recycled an argument for lower taxes that surfaced in the ’80s and ’90s, but recent history suggests that higher taxes might help the economy.

headline.seo: Effectiveness of Tax Cuts on Lifting the Economy Is Unproved
headline.main: Blessings of Low Taxes Remain Unproved
headline.print_headline: Blessings Of Low Taxes Remain Unproved
